results.title: Cool Cats: 25 Years of Rock `N` Roll
results.brief_description: Cool Cats traces the evolution of rock-related style, fashion and affectation; from stovepipe trousers, drape jackets and duck’s tail haircuts to bondage straps, androgynous jumpsuits and lethal Mohican scalp spikes. The performances and posturing of the Rolling Stones, Little Richard, Tina Turner, The Beatles, among others, are intertwined with observations from the likes of Pete Townshend, Phil Everly, Malcolm McLaren and Grace Slick. Rating: G

results.title: Conversation in the garden
results.creator_credit: Richard Mudford and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: A couple are seen in a suburban garden; outwardly they appear polite, inwardly their thoughts vividly snake through the undergrowth. Cast includes Heather Bolton and Stephen Clements.

results.title: Convention of Yanmar Overseas Agents, 1964
results.brief_description:
Convention held in Japan for overseas agents of the company Yanmar, founded by Magokichi Yamaoka. Shows the delegates involved in various activities including a visit to the factory, a bus trip to a memorial for the founder, group conference and discussion, social evening event, presentation of awards, a golf day, and the final gathering before departure.
Silent film - no credits available.

results.title: Controlled forces
results.brief_description: “Summary: translated from the German. original title- kontrollierte kraefte- eine dokumentation der suspa . describes suspa’s post-tensioning method whereby high tensile steel wires are installed in the building unit, and stressed with hydraulic jacks, after the concrete has hardened to impart maximum load-bearing capacity. shows the suspa factory in the rhineland and the pre- fabrication of tendons. the quality control standards (elongation tests, ultimate tensile tests, fatigue tests), are also illustrated. this bbrv method is able to be used in all branches of civil engineering”
results.description: “Summary: translated from the German. original title- kontrollierte kraefte- eine dokumentation der suspa . describes suspa’s post-tensioning method whereby high tensile steel wires are installed in the building unit, and stressed with hydraulic jacks, after the concrete has hardened to impart maximum load-bearing capacity. shows the suspa factory in the rhineland and the pre- fabrication of tendons. the quality control standards (elongation tests, ultimate tensile tests, fatigue tests), are also illustrated. this bbrv method is able to be used in all branches of civil engineering”

results.title: Contract with debt
results.creator_credit: Tony Wright, Penny Roberts and Video Projects
results.brief_description: Budget or bust! An important and relevant presentation of money matters as they are seen by teenagers. Using situations and dialogues which are a part of any teenager’s life the video presents a lively and amusing story of Amanda and Krystal as they learn about financial matters the hard way.

results.title: Contraception: ready or not? (Captioned)
results.brief_description: An internationally acclaimed program for teenagers developed to encourage responsible attitudes towards sex. It is not a comprehensive description of contraception methods but designed to stimulate discussion on issues surrounding contraceptive use. Features a reporter interviewing a sperm, an ovum and a group of teenagers to reveal the myths, misconceptions and truths about contraception. Accompanied by a 10p. Workbook.

results.title: Continents adrift
results.creator_credit: Lewis C. Hall and American Educational Films
results.brief_description: Shows how a scientific hypothesis becomes established in a study of Alfred Wegener’s hypothesis that at one time all the continents were one. Discusses paleomagnetism, sea floor spreading, magnetism in rock and the drifting magnetic poles. Suitable for secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lewis C. Hall and American Educational Films

results.title: Continental drift: the theory of plate tectonics
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Outlines the major features of the theory of plate tectonics and notes how the theory can be used to explain the distribution of the world’s major earthquake zones and areas of volcanic activity. Provides ample evidence to support the validity of the theory of plate tectonics and explores some possible explanations as to how the plates actually move. Suitable for upper secondary level.
